title: Landfills
summary: Landfills are large, carefully managed areas where our waste is stored. Learn how they work, what problems they cause, and what we can do to reduce landfill waste.
content1: When we throw something away, it often ends up in a landfill. Modern landfills are lined with protective layers to prevent toxic liquids from leaking into the ground. They also use pipes to collect gases like methane.
content2: Even with these safety measures, landfills can harm the environment. Methane is a powerful greenhouse gas that contributes to climate change, and valuable materials are lost when items are buried instead of reused or recycled.
content3: You can help by recycling more, composting food scraps, and buying products with less packaging. Every small action reduces how much ends up in landfills — and helps keep our planet clean and healthy!

title: Composting
summary: Composting turns organic waste into natural fertilizer for soil.
content1: Composting is a natural way to recycle food scraps and yard waste into rich soil. It helps plants grow and reduces the amount of waste sent to landfills.
content2: When composting, materials like fruit peels, coffee grounds, and grass clippings break down into a nutrient-rich soil additive.
content3: You can compost at home in a small bin or in your garden to reduce waste and support a greener planet.

title: Greenhouse Gases
summary: Greenhouse gases trap heat in the Earth's atmosphere, affecting climate change.
content1: Gases like carbon dioxide, methane, and nitrous oxide are released from human activities such as driving cars, farming, and burning fossil fuels.
content2: These gases trap heat from the sun, causing the planet’s temperature to rise — a process known as the greenhouse effect.
content3: Reducing energy use, planting trees, and using renewable energy sources can all help lower greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Recycling
summary: Recycling helps conserve resources and energy by turning old materials into new products.
content1: When we recycle items like paper, plastic, glass, and metal, we reduce the need to extract new raw materials.
content2: This saves energy, reduces pollution, and keeps waste out of landfills.
content3: Always check local recycling rules to make sure you’re sorting items correctly — every small effort counts!

title: Types of Food
summary: Different types of food have unique effects on the environment and our health.
content1: Fruits and vegetables generally have lower environmental impacts than meat and dairy products.
content2: Producing meat often requires more water and land, and generates more greenhouse gases.
content3: Eating more plant-based meals can help the planet and improve personal health.

title: Sustainability
summary: Sustainability means meeting our needs without harming future generations.
content1: Sustainable living involves using fewer resources, reducing waste, and protecting ecosystems.
content2: Small changes, like using reusable bags, conserving energy, and supporting eco-friendly products, make a big difference.
content3: Together, our daily choices can create a cleaner, fairer, and more sustainable world.
